doc:
Lon Clark https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lon_Clark 0 Lon Clark (January 12, 1912 – October 2, 1998) was a New York City actor of stage and radio. Clark was born in Frost, Minnesota. As a youth in Minnesota, Clark studied at the MacPhail Center for Music in Minneapolis. He began as a musician and actor in traveling tent shows, followed by a season with the Cincinnati Summer Opera. After participating in radio drama in Cincinnati, he arrived in New York during the 1940s, and his rich baritone voice quickly led to network radio roles. Lon_Clark ( January_12_,_1912 – October_2_,_1998 ) was a_New_York_City_actor of stage_and_radio . Clark was_born in Frost , Minnesota . As a_youth in Minnesota , Clark studied at the_MacPhail_Center for Music in Minneapolis . He began as a_musician_and_actor in traveling tent_shows , followed by a_season with the_Cincinnati_Summer_Opera . After participating in radio_drama in Cincinnati , he arrived in New_York during the_1940s , and his_rich_baritone_voice quickly led to network_radio_roles .
